â€œ.gitkeepâ€ isnâ€™t documented, because itâ€™s not a feature of Git.Git cannot add a completely empty directory. People who want to track empty directories in Git have created the convention of putting files called â€œ.gitkeepâ€ in these directories. The file could be called anything; Git assigns no special significance to this name.There is a competing convention of adding a â€œ.gitignoreâ€ file to the empty directories to get them tracked, but some people see this as confusing since the goal is to keep the empty directories, not ignore them; â€œ.gitignoreâ€ is also used to list files that should be ignored by Git when looking for untracked files.or you can use like this to except for this one: !.gitignore.git fetch repo å’Œ git fetch repo branch çš„åŒºåˆ« ?

#!/bin/sh
# chkconfig: 2345 85 15
# description:Nginx Server

NGINX_HOME=/usr/local/nginx
NGINX_SBIN=$NGINX_HOME/sbin/nginx
NGINX_CONF=$NGINX_HOME/conf/nginx.conf
NGINX_PID=$NGINX_HOME/logs/nginx.pid

NGINX_NAME=â€Nginxâ€

. /etc/rc.d/init.d/functions

if [ ! -f $NGINX_SBIN ]
then
echo â€œ$NGINX_NAME startup: $NGINX_SBIN not exists! â€œ
exit
fi

start() {
$NGINX_SBIN -c $NGINX_CONF
ret=$?
if [ $ret -eq 0 ]; then

else
action $â€Starting $NGINX_NAME: â€œ /bin/false
fi
}

stop() {
kill `cat $NGINX_PID`
ret=$?
if [ $ret -eq 0 ]; then

else
action $â€Stopping $NGINX_NAME: â€œ /bin/false
fi
}

restart() {
stop
start
}

check() {
$NGINX_SBIN -c $NGINX_CONF -t
}

reload() {
kill -HUP `cat $NGINX_PID` && echo â€œreload success!â€
}

relog() {
kill -USR1 `cat $NGINX_PID` && echo â€œrelog success!â€
}

case â€œ$1â€ in
start)
start
;;
stop)
stop
;;
restart)
restart
;;
check|chk)
check
;;
status)
status -p $NGINX_PID
;;
reload)
reload
;;
relog)
relog
;;
*)
echo $â€Usage: $0 {start|stop|restart|reload|status|check|relog}â€
exit 1
esac
